block.p: Katherine Ann Walther and Jason Andrew Carey, lawyers in Washington, were married yesterday afternoon at Ash Lawn-Highland, the James Monroe home in Charlottesville, Va. The Rev. Rick Ballin, a Unitarian Universalist minister, performed the ceremony.

The bride, a graduate of Washington and Lee University, and the bridegroom, who graduated from Williams College, received law degrees from the University of Virginia, where they met. They are now law firm associates, she at Dickstein, Shapiro, Morin & Oshinsky, and he at McDermott, Will & Emery.

Katherine Ann Walther and Jason Andrew Carey, lawyers in Washington, were married yesterday afternoon at Ash Lawn-Highland, the James Monroe home in Charlottesville, Va. The Rev. Rick Ballin, a Unitarian Universalist minister, performed the ceremony.

The bride, a graduate of Washington and Lee University, and the bridegroom, who graduated from Williams College, received law degrees from the University of Virginia, where they met. They are now law firm associates, she at Dickstein, Shapiro, Morin & Oshinsky, and he at McDermott, Will & Emery.

Between college and law school, the bride, now 30, taught English and economics at Kaliningrad Technical University in Russia and worked as assistant program director of the European department at the Center for Democracy, a nonprofit organization in Washington. She is a daughter of Mary Ann and Richard G. Walther of Warrenton, Va. Her father owns three Burger King franchises in the Warrenton area.

The bridegroom, 26, is a son of Sandra G. Carey and Robert G. Carey, both of Wilmington, Del. His mother teaches history, English and social science at St. Helena's School in Wilmington. His father is a lawyer there.
